boardgame.name: Animal Races in the Kingdom of Grimsby
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you want to incorporate animal player characters into your adventures? These are homebrewed races of 6 different animals:


Cat
Donkey
Giant Owl
Hound
Raven
Rooster


These races are featured in [The Kingdom of Grimsby Bremen Town-Musicians], but can also be used in any 5e adventure on its own.

boardgame.name: Ghosted
boardgame.description:
You've come to an untimely end, been offed, put to rest, fatally finished. You've been ghosted!

Now you must solve your own demise from the great beyond. Identify which suspect had it in for you, what wacky weapon they used, and why they wanted you out of the picture. The first to solve the mystery of their passing wins Ghosted.

boardgame.name: Lunar
boardgame.description:
Earth’s first colonies have arrived and are fighting each other for precious resources and ultimately, survival. You’re thousands of miles away from Earth with orders to protect the most vital assets of your homeland’s colony. Will you take hold on the moon or drift off into the void?

Lunar is a brutal 32mm skirmish game set during humanity’s battle for lunar superiority. Choose from a variety of factions including the USA, USSR, Republic of China and more.

Each box includes everything you and friend need to play, including a range of multipart resin astronauts that will allow you to create two opposing forces equipped with a variety of weapons and items.

A game of Lunar is played with 3-5 miniatures per side on a 2’×2′ area. Gameplay is based on a simple D6 mechanic that makes the game easy to understand and easy to teach new players.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Rise of Yog-Sothoth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Another day, another eldritch apocalypse. You and the rest of your team were called in when the apocalypse prevention team at Miskatonic University identified another eldritch threat to all of human existence. Why you? Well, your number got pulled out of the “Who Saves The World This Time?” fishbowl.

You are briefed at the office by a crack team of expert historians and occult ritualists who have been collaborating on these cases. The situation facing your team is this: A literal psychic storm is growing. This malevolent psychic force has manifested as an enormous grey rain cloud that hovers over its victims’ heads, making them increasingly despondent until they lose all hope. Without hope, these people turn into mirthless enforcers of an invisible agenda. Those under its strongest effects seem to be obeying commands that only they can perceive.

Worse still, the more people under the cloud, the more powerful it becomes, spreading more readily to new victims who come in contact with anyone already afflicted. Groups of its victims are gathering, moving with grim determination towards population centers. Nobody can explain the phenomenon, which scientists and policy makers refer to as “the hope-killing plague,” though trending topics on social media have dubbed it the #EeyoreEffect, which is, admittedly, a clever name for a truly horrific phenomenon. So, fairly standard Internet response there.

By combining ritual experimentation and historical research, the occult and historical teams here in modern-day 2050 have developed a series of time travel rituals that have sent many teams like yours back in time to nip these kinds of apocalypses in the bud. The nature of cause and effect has obscured just how many times it’s happened, but evidence suggests that teams have already prevented apocalypses caused by Cthulhu, Dagon, Hastur, Nyarlathotep, Hastur again, some sort of big robot, and the King in Yellow.

It’s a great system, and there’s only a very slight possibility that it’ll cause horrific eldritch corruption.

A CAUTIONARY NOTE ABOUT THIS TIMELINE

This is the silly timeline. Sure, wherever there’s eldritch weirdness going on, there’s potential for comedy, but here, the PCs are face-to-tentacles with a being that transcends spacetime as we know it—a thing more powerful by orders of magnitude than any of the other Great Old Ones. There is no reasonable, rational way to fight a being for whom the linear flow of time is optional. As such, things are unreasonable and irrational. Here, the bad guys are larger-than-life, the events are absurd, and sometimes cartoon logic works. Lean into it!

boardgame.name: Mixed Doubles
boardgame.description:
A risk-taking dice game of colorful combinations.

GO ALL IN | STEAL CARDS | CREATE NEW COLORS | WIN THE JACKPOT

Players take turns making wagers, rolling the dice, and mixing colors in order to earn points. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

How to win points:
On their turn, a player draws three cards and places them face up in their palette (i.e., pile). The player has the option to wager one or more cards (of one color) to the jackpot. The player then rolls the dice. If they successfully "mix" colors (e.g., by rolling a yellow + blue to create green), the player wins all green cards in their palette and the jackpot. If the player wagered green cards on their turn, they also win the green cards in the other players' palettes.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hacktivity
boardgame.description:
A new virus has been detected in cyberspace.

According to your investigation, the virus’ origin is linked to the activation of quantum generators, a new source of infinite energy.
You and your team will dive into the depths of cyberspace and attempt to break through the generators’ defenses to short-circuit them once and for all.

Game Details:
Hacktivity is a cooperative story-driven campaign card game for 1 to 4 players. Immerse yourself as one of the four unique characters.
Each turn, draw cards from your character deck and/or the virus deck. Your first goal is to use up all the cards from the virus deck.


Play a virus card on the Antivirus Interface to paralyse it.
Then, play character cards to attack and deactivate the virus. You will be able to attack the quantum generator as well or restore your Firewall.
Watch out! Be careful to not generate too much interference.
Maintain strong communications among your teammates to implement the optimal strategy.
Everyone can participate in each scenario in this inclusively designed card game.
Follow the storyline of the campaign in the Scenarios Booklet.
Open new sealed decks to reveal new cards and unlock new abilities.


The game will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end!.
Dive into cyberspace now with Hacktivity!

— description from the designer

boardgame.name: 221B Baker St.: Sherlock Holmes & the Time Machine – Set #2
boardgame.description:
An additional set of cases for 221B Baker St.: Sherlock Holmes & the Time Machine. This package comprises cases #21-40:

21. The speeding bullet (1959)
22. The forty whacks (1892)
23. The final flight (1937)
24. Even blondes get the blues (1962)
25. Death of a dream (1968)
26. The twisted cord (1977)
27. The bushy-haired man (1954)
28. The Candy Man's Wife (1977)
29. The flamingo's curse (1947)
30. The blood-stained laundryman (1929)
31. The empty bench (1930)
32. The body on the beach (1931)
33. The sea-tac slayings (1980's)
34. The vicar's last sermon (1924)
35. The right field shot (1988)
36. The nebulous nuggets (1949)
37. The jolly girls' lament (1967)
38. The president's man (1993)
39. The buried hatchet (1918)
40. The walking corpse (1935)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: 221B Baker St.: Sherlock Holmes & the Time Machine

boardgame.name: Pirates
boardgame.description:
In Pirates, you play as a captain in the world of the swashbuckling pirate comic Bonnie Lass, created and illustrated by the game's artist, Michael Mayne.

In the game, you attempt to capture ships, fortresses, and even sea monsters to accumulate the most treasure. On most turns, you will form a boarding party by taking a stack of pirates in front of you (with a stack consisting of one or more tokens with you on top), moving them on top of a stack in front of another player, then moving the new stack back in front of you.

On a future turn, you may use this stack to capture one of the four cards in the display as long as the size of the party meets the minimum requirements. The pirate on top of stack is the captain, and they receive a treasure for leading the raid. (The second pirate in the stack, the mate, might also receive a treasure.) They collect the gold listed on the card, then must pay the value listed on each pirate in their crew, making up any gold they lack from their own coffers. If they do this, they keep the card and increase their scoring.

You can mutiny by placing a stack on another stack, then going after one of the four cards immediately, but you must then pay the mate and the rest of the crew double their pay.

After all cards have been captured and the game ends, players receive additional gold based on the relative number of treasures they have captured. Whoever ends up with the most gold wins.

boardgame.name: Dreampunk
boardgame.description:
From back of book

At night, you dream. Your dreams are not idle imaginings, but visits to a persistent world of wonders and dangers both personal and alien. Will you find power there? Will you find freedom? Or will you slowly slip into Entanglement?

Play to find out!

Dreampunk is a tabletop roleplaying game for 2-6 players. It uses a deck of surreal art cards to inspire creative and unexpected adventures in an uncanny dreamworld. It can be played with or without a dedicated Guide.

boardgame.name: Star of Alladore (Issue 1 - 2020)
boardgame.description:
Star of Alladore
Issue 1

The Official Rangers of Shadow Deep Fanzine
boardgame.rpg: Rangers of Shadow Deep: A Tabletop Adventure Game

boardgame.name: Marrakesh
boardgame.description:
Compete with other influential families in the city to achieve the most honorable titles through the skillful use of assistants and resources at your disposal. The player who succeeds in doing this best becomes the new "Obermufti" of Marrakesh.

Marrakesh is played over three rounds, with each round consisting of four turns. On each turn, players simultaneously and secretly choose three colored cylinders from behind their screen. Then, in turn order, they place matching colored assistants on their player board and perform the corresponding action, then all cylinders are placed in the cube tower. Then, in turn order, players select a color and take 1-2 of the cylinders that have passed through the tower (or those that were stuck from a previous round but have now emerged) and place them on their player boards. These cylinders will enhance future actions taken in the same color in future rounds.

Actions allow players to gain wealth, which can be traded for influence in the city. Performing various actions also earns bonuses and enhances actions even more as the game proceeds. The player who scores the most points by the end of the game wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dread Metrol: Into the Mists
boardgame.description:
An Eberron/Ravenloft Crossover

From the introduction:

Dread Metrol is a city enduring an endless siege. The undead legions of Karrnath have maintained their assault for years, and every night, new forces emerge from the Mists. Within the city, Queen Dannel ir’Wynarn tightens her grip, determined to find a way to turn the tide of battle. As resources dwindle, the war machine is consuming the people of Metrol. The bodies of the dead are fused to constructs to create tireless soldiers, while citizens who don’t contribute to the war effort are sent to the Vadalis Kennels and subjected to horrific experiments. As terrifying as the undead forces are, the queen’s relentless pursuit of victory is the source of the greatest horrors.

boardgame.name: Dread Metrol: Player Edition
boardgame.description:
An Eberron/Ravenloft Crossover

From the introduction:

Dread Metrol is a city enduring an endless siege. The undead legions of Karrnath have maintained their assault for years, and every night, new forces emerge from the Mists. Within the city, Queen Dannel ir’Wynarn tightens her grip, determined to find a way to turn the tide of battle. As resources dwindle, the war machine is consuming the people of Metrol. The bodies of the dead are fused to constructs to create tireless soldiers, while citizens who don’t contribute to the war effort are sent to the Vadalis Kennels and subjected to horrific experiments. As terrifying as the undead forces are, the queen’s relentless pursuit of victory is the source of the greatest horrors.

boardgame.name: Uncertain Life
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Turmish, a land once greatly diminished by the Spellplague, was embracing a new era of prosperity. Between the rising of the Inner Sea as a direct result of the Great Rain, and the foundation of the Emerald Enclave, trade had returned to the once beleaguered region.

boardgame.name: Disparity Trap
boardgame.description:
Disparity Trap: The Socially Conscious Board Game provides an easy way to have the hard conversations around race & privilege in America and how they impact society in systemically dominant (SD) and systemically non-dominant (SND) ways. The game play is like many of its kind, where your individual goal is to accrue as much wealth as possible.

But where it differs is that you can have a team goal as well where you work with your fellow players to dismantle the Disparity Traps seeking to keep everyone in poverty. Within this game you also step into someone else’s shoes; to experience the disparities within an identity different from your own. Throughout the game, the dice roll correlates your identity in the game to real life statistics.

So like life, the dice are in your “hands,” but the odds are not.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Fight for the Dawn Saber
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

In the sweltering heat of mid-Marpenoth, all of Waterdeep is on edge as the City Watch investigates the murder of a prominent cleric, a bloody act that occurred in the Trades Ward where you and your friends make their home. When the Seekers’ agent contacts you to begin another of their mysterious scavenger hunts, you are eager for a chance to leave the heat of the city behind.

Using the portal under the old Lantanese Embassy, you journey to a deserted island in search of a missing ship, the Dawn Saber. But you are not alone in looking for the famous treasure vessel; pirates and other threats await you, ready to end your adventure before it truly begins.

boardgame.name: Eight Petals Argent
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

You return to Waterdeep after an extended absence, only to find your old friends embroiled in a scheme to steal an artifact from the City of the Dead. In this adventure, evade the Watch to infiltrate the cemetery district, survive ambushes on city streets, and race to recover forgotten magic from the lost nation of Lantan.

boardgame.name: BLASTER: Games Anthology 03
boardgame.description:
BLASTER: Vol. 3 includes an exclusive standalone game, Sludge War, and four expansions:


Sludge War (Standalone Game) - Sludge is a complete and incredibly rich standalone game. Massive armies are on the march in an unceasing conflict that shadows over humanity, and even the environment, grinding it all down into a pulp. It is 52 pages of inglorious black powder plus gaming at its finest.



Shadowgrave Part II - Official Expansion for Rangers of Shadow Deep, Frostgrave, and Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago. The worlds of Rangers of Shadow Deep and Frostgrave are being invaded from unfathomable horrors that their heroes can barely stand up against. Will you wield magic to defend against the darkest threat your world has seen? And at what cost are you willing to do so?



Gaslands: Legacy - Official Campaign Expansion for Gaslands: Refuelled. Earth gets an eviction notice from Mars, and becomes dismantled and reassembled into a progressively more chaotic post-post-apocalyptic world. Randomly generate an illegal build and get out of the factory fast before you become dismantled yourself. Unique LEGACY Gaslands rules, and five awesome narrative scenarios. Find out more here.



Gamma Wolves: Ronin - Official Expansion for Gamma Wolves - Mecha pilots vie for dwindling resources on a post-apocalyptic earth. What path will your mercenary pilot take? Will she follow The Path of the Guardian and fight to protect her team? Will she follow the Path of the Sword and down enemy mechs in honorable combat? Or will she prefer to stalk her prey with the Path of the Hunter?



The Mysterious Anomalies of Site-X - Official Expansion for This is Not a Test. Truly unpredictable anomalies plague Site-X, a supplement for This is Not a Test. Will your quest for some of the rarest and powerful artifacts aid your survival or send your models flying across the board into a wall, or even being shred up into indiscernible viscera?


This PDF document presents print-and-play expansion modules for the miniatures games noted above.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Gamma Wolves: A Game of Post-Apocalyptic Mecha Warfare
This Is Not a Test: Post-Apocalyptic Skirmish Rules

boardgame.name: ...and then you die.
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

“...and then you die.” is a game about life at the end of life; it is about an end to the work of breathing; it is about how petty life becomes when time is at its most scarce. It's about getting the largest helping of creamed corn before losing your last shred of dignity at tonight's sponge bath. Players roleplay life in a retirement home; one character will kick the big golden bucket before the end of the session. How it happens and what it means is up to the players.

User summary:

The game uses dominos as a randomizer; the document includes an oversize character sheet.

boardgame.name: Ariadne's Caretakers
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Mysterious time travelling monks from a distant future singularity travel back in time to ensure their precious time machine comes into being. They play a game of temporal whack-a-mole as resolving one problem creates another until everything is smoothed over. The twist: they may have their own agendas to serve.

boardgame.name: The Book of Threads
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

There is a web-site that contains every true thing on Earth. What would you do with edit access?

Σ

boardgame.name: Causality: Paradox in Time Travel
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Causality is a game about paradox. Questions that have no answer. Conflicting truths.

In it, you play a time traveller from a future that is on the verge of destruction. You’re sent back in time (usually against your will) to prevent or foster an event that led humanity to the grim future we ended up with. Every action you take will create a new reality, but each new reality you create becomes more and more unpredictable. When the laws of space and time crumble before you, can you keep your sanity intact long enough to save the future?

boardgame.name: Death Planet 1
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

What is a Death Planet 1: It is an ultra-simple science fiction roleplaying game where you and your team of warriors land on a jungle planet infected with lurking, alien lifeforms and deadly plant life. All of intent on killing you.

You must retrieve crucial data files from a ship that has crashed here and try to safely rescue the two crew onboard. Then pray the extraction ship arrives in time.

boardgame.name: Chocolate Dynamite
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the land of warriors and wizards, one class stands above all in the war between humanity and the Dragons: The Chocolatier. Producing delicious chocolate sweets, they roam the countryside challenging each other for the right to fight the dragons, and create hope for the children of the landed gentry. A gritty, serious, thought-provoking game for 3-5 players.

boardgame.name: Traders of Cardonia
boardgame.description:
Traders of Cardonia is a medieval trading-themed package with its own unique setting. It contains a set of 3 different games.

Trading Cards: A worker placement game where the cards you play as workers with special abilities are played to a grid with unique worker placement markets on the backs. Because you choose which workers and markets to use within each game, the strategies in each game will change. And because the workers in your opponents' hands are also markets that are not available to you, the game is ever-changing from beginning to end.

Tricks of the Trade: A trick-taking card game based on the Dyad system (Dyad) in which the resources are scarce, and you must obligate other players to buy your trade goods to sell them. Assemble a team of workers that allow you to access unique special abilities.

Medley: A unique blended game experience that combines the worker placement in Trading Cards with the trick-taking aspects of Tricks of the Trade. As you play a worker placement phase, you will also draft from the available cards which can be played to tricks in the trick-taking phase.

Trading Cards and Medley also feature AI opponents for a solitaire game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.description:

Enclosed in a deluxe matte wrapped box, this collection contains 1 settlement event, 4 unique gear cards, art cards for each pinup, and 11 highly detailed hard plastic models.

boardgame.name: Replicants!: United Sol Colonies
boardgame.description:
The Replicants are starting to adjust to a solar system devoid of organic life. It was chaos at first, but, for the most part, the mega hives a have started to create some stability. The United Sol Colonies, or U.S.C. for short (who this expansion is focused on), are doing their part to bring structure (or structures =P) to the system. They are currently building a network of space stations that all Replicants may have access to, provided they follow a few simple rules:


No fighting on the space stations.
Use the rooms you need to and move on, so others may use them too.
Help build additions to the stations you visit.
Everyone must spend their own resources to activate functions they wish to use.
Stay out of other hives’ lockers.


In the U.S.C. Expansion you will pick your favorite hive and join the effort to make the system a better place for all Replicants.

Game play, for the most part, is similar to the core game (which is required to play the expansion.)

Like in the core game, you will deal out a resource grid each round, and place your drones to collect resources. But between those two phases, you now have a Station phase. During the Station phase, you will get to move your two personnel around the station to access the functions of the different rooms. Room functions consist of things like: build new rooms, resource discounts when leveling up new replicants, buying points, and more.

After the Drone phase, you still spend the resources you produced or gained to level up your Replicants. However, instead of discarding any unused resources from your hand at the end of the round, you now send them off to your locker on the space station. Once resources are in your locker, you may not use them for leveling up your replicants, but they can be used for activating any functions on the station.

boardgame.name: The Desert Rose: A Story Game About What Drives Us
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Is the Desert an inter-dimensional nexus? A world on the edge of dreams? A twisted, magical version of the Arabian Nights? You have no idea. But to obtain your heart's desire, you must find the Desert Rose.
boardgame.rpg: The Desert Rose: A Story Game About What Drives Us

boardgame.name: Neoclassical Geek Revival Second Edition Basic Rulebook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Neoclassical Geek Revival (NGR) is a take on classic RPGs to the extent that none of the original mechanics survive. This is the Basic set of the 2nd Edition rules.

boardgame.name: Doloris
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the year 2100, Cyberpunk Catholics fight Rosicrucian oppression They must choose whether to help others in this world or themselves in the next. Doloris is a game about faith, free will, and consequences for 4 players.

User summary:

Doloris features boardgame elements fused with roleplaying opportunities.

boardgame.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Survival Action Tokens: Percival
boardgame.description:
Promo survival action tokens that were included with the Pinups Of Death IV that was not part of the based game.

A new pinup collection containing 13 miniatures originally offered in the Kingdom Death: Monster 1.5 Kickstarter campaign. Enclosed in a deluxe matte wrapped box, this collection contains 6 survival action tokens, art cards for each pinup, and 13 highly detailed hard plastic miniatures.

Each box makes 13 miniatures and contains:
6 double-sided survival tokens featuring Pinup Percival. Use these tokens to show available or spent survival actions for your survivors.

boardgame.name: The Ninth Assassin
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
Eight of the nine assassins who killed your master and murdered your family are now dead, justice having been served by a team of Rōnin who have sought vengeance over these last fifteen years. You are now the only survivor of that group of hunters, with one last assassin to track down and kill. Will you succeed in restoring your honour, or will events instead GO SOUTH?

This book contains an interactive short story where the reader makes the decisions for the main character. It is written in straightforward prose for older teens and adults who struggle with reading and places the reader straight into the action where their choices determine who lives and who dies. This volume is designed to be as portable as possible; an alternative to having a phone stuck to your face while travelling or sitting quietly at home. It doesn't require any dice, pencils or erasers to play; you only need the book.

boardgame.name: No Good Deed
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

NO GOOD DEED is an investigative scenario that that will throw an unsuspecting AEGIS Cell into a race against time. From a seemingly straightforward police shooting through to experiments with Saurian DNA, as the old saying goes ‘no good deed ever goes unpunished’.

Designed to introduce new players to the world of Conspiracy X. It should take no more than a few hours to complete, but this could be extended by both the players actions and the Chronicler’s desire to explore some of the key plot points further.

boardgame.name: Medica Plantarum
boardgame.description:
"Medica Plantarum is a rules expansion for herbalism and/or potion craft within TTRPGs. This guide was written with the goal of science education. It’s a TTRPG guide for players or GMs who think plants and fungi are cool, and are looking for an interesting way to bring some real botany into their games.

On the surface, this is a mechanic to recreate, or create new potions, fill party downtime, or inspire character agency. At its core, this is an educational guide for players or GMs who want to use real plant biology to inform their potion craft. Medica Plantarum presents biology, history, folklore, and mythology to give folks a unique lens in which to discover the wonder of plant diversity.

The ultimate goal of this guide is to inspire players and GMs to create their own potions by learning about the plants around them. For this reason, Medica Plantarum is free to encourage others to bring a love of plants into the TTRPG space."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Runes of Zun: Arcane Secrets
boardgame.description:
The Arcane Secrets Expansion will transform how you play Runes of Zun. This expansion is all about advanced knowledge, fortune, and card manipulation.

There are six new action types (good and bad), a new reaction type, and a new and unique modifier type. Mix them into your original game for a total of 78 cards. If you also mix in the original Action Packed Expansion and the Shadow Tactics Expansion, you'll get a total of 114 cards in your deck (or 123 with all the promos!)

New tactics will emerge, and game-changing combos will win out. Are you ready?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Game of Life: A Day at the Dog Park
boardgame.description:
Hit the dog park and share the adventures and surprises of dogs at play! The Game of Life: A Day at the Dog Park pet edition board game is a dog lover's version of classic The Game of Life gameplay. In this game it's all about the treats that are used to buy Dog Bones. Players can get them by landing on a Dog Bone or Steal a Dog Bone space, pulling an Action card, winning Spin to Win, or paying the baker.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: UNO Showdown
boardgame.description:
UNO Showdown is the matching card game everyone loves but with the unexpected excitement of a card-shooting smackdown! When the lightning sounds and the UNO Showdown unit signal goes off, be the first to push down on the paddle. The quickest player wins the showdown and sends cards flying out of the UNO Showdown unit at their opponents! Players race to get rid of all their cards by matching them to the card shown on top of the deck. When players are down to one card, they must remember to yell "UNO!" Fun for kid, family or adult game night and a great gift for players ages 7 years and older.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Title: Uno Showdown Publisher: Mattel Language(s): English German Dutch

boardgame.name: Hermit Dwarf
boardgame.description: A sea-inspired class for use with Old School Essentials.

boardgame.name: Pearl Diver
boardgame.description: A class for Old School Essentials.

boardgame.name: How We Met
boardgame.description:
A game about the potholes on the road to love

From the introduction:

How We Met is a game about how a couple overcame all obstacles to be together. The game helps you tell a story, which comes from the memory of the two main characters. Inconsistencies are bound to appear as the character's perceptions of events clash. No one can know what really happened, but they can look at the strength of the relationship that was formed.

boardgame.name: In the Company of Strangers
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the Company of Strangers is a role-playing game that puts the players in the roles of English and German soldiers who are trapped in an ancient, underground temple, the Sealed Palace, constructed in the heyday of Zoroastrianism. Their memories in pieces due to the destructive influence of the demonic daeva, they must rediscover who they are and come to terms with the tribulations of their own pasts to escape. But who is an agent of the King and who serves the Kaiser?

boardgame.name: Православни Хероји (Orthodox Heroes)
boardgame.description:
Players play alternately. They use their deck of cards made up of saints, buildings and prayer cards.
There is also a common group of cards that bring negative points and they are activated as soon as the condition is met - sins.
By activating the blessings of the saints as well as by fulfilling the conditions of the buildings and prayers, points are collected. The first player to collect 100 points wins.

—user summary

"Orthodox Heroes" is a new social card game. The goal of this game is to achieve faith and get acquainted with the Orthodox elements. For all ages.

—description from the designer (translated)

"Православни Хероји" су нова друштвена картична игра. Циљ ове игре је постизање вере и упознавање са православнм елементима. За све узрасте.
—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Bestiarium
boardgame.description: Bestiarium is an unofficial bestiary for Mausritter.

boardgame.name: Richtig oder falsch?: Quiz
boardgame.description:
Quiz game with tricky questions and answers. E.g. "Are there more camels in China than in Egypt? The guessing person has to decide if it is right or wrong and then you read out the interesting answer. The person who gets the most 'right' wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: World of Warcraft: Wrath of the Lich King
Пандемия: World of Warcraft
월드 오브 워크래프트: 리치 왕의 분노
boardgame.description:
In World of Warcraft: Wrath of the Lich King, players journey to the frozen continent of Northrend to face the armies of the Lich King. This "Pandemic System" game showcases familiar mechanisms and gameplay, now tweaked to embrace the setting of the Wrath of the Lich King. Forts, temples, battlegrounds, and more populate the game board as you and your fellow heroes journey across the cold landscape. Along the way, you'll set up strongholds, complete quests, and do battle with legions of undead.

In more detail, players team up as legendary heroes from across Azeroth, each with their own unique abilities to help in and out of combat. Heroes such as Thrall, Warchief of the Horde; Varian Wrynn, King of Stormwind; Sylvanas Windrunner, Banshee Queen of the Forsaken; and many more are at your fingertips. As the Scourge grows, more undead will populate the board. Throw dice as you enter into battle against the hordes of ghouls and ferocious abominations, using hero cards to add power to your attacks, block incoming assaults, heal wounds, take mounts to far off spaces, and so much more.

As you fight your way to the Lich King, all manner of dark magic and terrible creatures under his control need to be neutralized. This comes in the form of quests, a brand-new mechanism that can be completed as a team through a combination of dice rolls and the hero cards at your disposal. However, each quest comes with its own dangers and hindrances. Complete these quests to move closer to the final assault on Icecrown Citadel, where the Lich King himself resides.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2022 UK Games Expo Best Variant Judges Award Winner
2022 UK Games Expo Best Variant Nominee
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Railroad Ink Challenge, Blitz Bowl, World of Warcraft Pandemic?!? - Boards & Swords #177
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: World of Warcraft: Wrath of the Lich King – Brann Bronzebeard
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: World of Warcraft: Wrath of the Lich King – Feldherr Insert

Title: World of Warcraft: Wrath of the Lich King Publisher: Z-Man Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Prison Break Insanity
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Prison Break Insanity is an epic steampunk prison escape oneshot designed for 4 to 6 Level 5 characters for use with the 5th Edition ruleset.

boardgame.name: Rekorde Raten
boardgame.description:
A trivia game with 80 questions about curious records. A game leader reads out the questions and the other players answer simultaneously. Whoever is correct receives one of the 30 score cards. After 30 point cards have been distributed, the player with the most points wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Necromunda: House of Faith
boardgame.description:
From the outside, other Necromundans see House Cawdor as bonepickers, scavengers and beggars, little better than hive rats. But House Cawdor has faith, a faith so strong that it has been saved from extinction where so many other Clan Houses have succumbed to the march of time or other disasters.

Get the ultimate guide to House Cawdor. This 136-page hardback book features the definitive history of the House and rules for fielding the eight different types of fighters available to House Cawdor – Word-Keepers, Priests, Firebrands, Deacons, Cawdor Brethren, Redemptionist Brethren, Bonepickers, and Zealots. It's ideal for fans of House Cawdor or anyone who wants to delve deeper into the dark side of the underhive.

Inside this book you will find:


House Cawdor History and Background: An expansive and extensive background on the origins of House Cawdor and how it went on to become the largest clan on Necromunda.
House Cawdor Gang List: All the rules you need in order to field a Cawdor Gang in games of Necromunda, including rules for using Redemptionists in your gangs or for fielding gangs made entirely of these flaming zealots.
Hangers-on and Brutes: Rules for hiring Hangers-on and Brutes for your Gang, including Cawdor-specific ones and for using them in games of Necromunda.
Hired Guns: Rules for using Bounty Hunters, House Agents, and Hive Scum.
Strong Alliances: Rules for forming alliances with three organisations that House Cawdor has connections with, including the Corpse Guild, Rogue Factoria, and House Ko'iron – the Noble House that backs the House of Faith.
Additional Rules: This section includes new and additional rules usable by House Cawdor gangs in games of Necromunda, providing Cawdor players a variety of options, including Skills, Abilities, and gang-specific terrain.
Weapon Reference Chart: A comprehensive weapons reference chart for all weapons and wargear available to House Cawdor and their Allies.
House Cawdor Gang Tactics: A D66 table of Gang Tactics for use in Scenarios.
Dramatis Personae: Rules for hiring and using four brand-new Dramatis Personae characters in your games of Necromunda.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: On the Rocks: Promo Drink Cards
boardgame.description: 40 new drink recipes with rainbow ingredient spaces. Each recipe has two wild spaces, which are easier to fulfil, but earns $1 less than usual.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Vikings
boardgame.description:
Follow the stories of one of the most famous Nordic heroes, Ragnar Lothbrok, his wife, the shield maid Lagertha and his brother Rollo, along with many other characters.

Enter the mysterious world of the Northmen: war, power and fraternity. You can become one of them in this game!

Choose one of the special characters, collect your favourite characters and kingdoms and build boats and longships. The Odin and Valhalla cards can bring blessings or curse. But be careful! In order not to displease the gods, you will have to make sacrifices.

Are you ready for this adventure.

boardgame.name: Titans: The Fallen Titan
boardgame.description:
The Fallen are summoned to the battle and the underworld is disturbed. The fallen titan of a past age wakes up from the other side and stands to fight his last battle. He has no obligation to one Nation, but his eternal reason – as for any titan – is to wage war. He will move from army to army, sowing terror in the hearts of his enemies.

The Fallen Titan has the same size scale to the other Titans and the miniature is 6.7 cm tall because of his pose.

boardgame.name: More Dinosaurs, Please
boardgame.description:
This is an expansion for Dinosaur Table Battles. What happened is that Mary asked for more dinosaurs – she may or may not have said please, and it may or may not have been a request. Regardless, six new dino-combatants are ready to join the fifteen from the base game.

Some of the new dinos are classified as Air Dinos and some as Wet Dinos. Air Dinos ignore blocks – unless those blocks are thrown by other Air Dinos! Likewise, the targeting restrictions of Wet Dinos can be negated by enemy Wet Dinos. Air Dinos and Wet Dinos are also weaker against each other – Air Dinos aren't very strong swimmers, and Wet Dinos are afraid of heights. From the massive Quetzalcoatlus to the cunning Gallimimus, these new dinosaurs can dramatically change the flow of a match.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Air, Land & Sea: Bestioles en Guerre
Air, Land, and Sea: Critters at War
Zwierzęcy Front
boardgame.description:
In Air, Land & Sea: Critters at War, two players vie for control over each theater of war by playing cards and strategically utilizing their special abilities to win battles. Whoever gains the most victory points over several battles wins the war!

Gameplay is the same in this standalone game as in Air, Land & Sea, but with 100% critters and more vibrant colors.

Title: Air, Land, and Sea: Critters at War Publisher: Arcane Wonders Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Inconsistency Attack! - the Webcomic RPG
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Are you a reader of webcomics? Are you a writer of webcomics?
Then Inconsistency Attack! is a game for you! Get some friends together, grab some polyhedral dice, dream up a cast of zany characters and before you know it, the jokes will be flying through the air! Inconsistency Attack! is a game that tries to leave it up to you, rather than put you in a run-of-the-mill fantasy world and boggle you with minutiæ and tactical rules matrices. All you need is a simple, stereotypical, sketchy character outline, that you will build up into a complex being as storylines progress.

boardgame.name: Shards of a Dying God
boardgame.description:
A Game of Existential Mythopoesis

From the introduction:

A God is dying, adrift in the waters of forgetfulness. He clings to his divine existence tenaciously, but with an ever flagging strength his doom washes over him in wave after relentless wave. In half dreamed recollections, the God struggles to remember himself, his life and the myths that surround him. In the Stygian darkness, his Sacred Story is in peril of being forgotten. And with the loss of that memory, comes only an ignoble end.

Only when a God is forgotten will he truly die.

boardgame.name: Pandemic: The Cure – Experimental Meds: Character Meeples
boardgame.description: This set contains 1 of each of 8 characters, suitable for Pandemic The Cure - Experimental Meds. Each Character Meeple is approximately 19mm tall.

boardgame.name: Magic Rose: An Urban Fantasy
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Something happened to the World. Nobody knows why and how, but magic rose. In our written medieval history there were a lot of cloudy mentions about magic. Ninety-nine percent of them were not true. Before Middle Ages, in the high empires like Egypt, Mayan Empire or the ancient Chinese there were true magical traditions. We do not know what happened, but once rituals, symbols and magical items did not work any more. Magic was sleeping in the last few thousand years. This game starts a few years or months after the Magic rose.

boardgame.name: Price of Progress
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fated are quietly recruited by Condor Rails, the largest rail company in Malifaux, for a job. They’re supposed to see if a very particular spot outside Edge Point might be suitable for a new rail line. The pay is good… but your contact doesn’t want you asking too many questions. Will the Fated keep quiet, or bravely work to dig up Condor’s buried secrets?

Price of Progress is a challenging One Shot adventure for the Through the Breach roleplaying game. It requires the Core Rules to play.

boardgame.name: A Night in Hallow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Carving Day in Malifaux is a time of both celebration and fear. Old things rise from their slumbers and trudge through the city streets, but festive jack o’ lanterns, candy, and all-night parties let the people enjoy fun and festivities. These same celebrations are happening in Hallow… so the Fated are led to believe. The contract town is not all it seems, and it will be up to the celebrating Fated to uncover the ghastly secrets right in front of their noses.

A Night in Hallow is a challenging One Shot adventure for the Through the Breach roleplaying game. It requires the Core Rules to play.

boardgame.name: Into the Logic Engine
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fated meet with a Scavenger who needs help bringing in a wayward construct. He offers to split the considerable profits fairly, and even pays for the train out from Ridley. But as always in Malifaux, things aren’t what they seem. The construct has a damaged Soulstone; a flash of neon light, a big twist, and some weird geometry will see the Fated brought into a realm they’ve never experienced before.

Into the Logic Engine is a challenging One Shot adventure for the Through the Breach roleplaying game. It requires the Core Rules to play.

boardgame.name: Voyage to the Moon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fated respond to a call from the eccentric and exclusive Explorer’s Society. It’s a job unlike any other: Professor James Vernon (and his enthusiastic but frazzled assistant) are planning a trip to the moon! Well, one of them. Specifically Delios, the dark moon of Malifaux. The Fated must prepare themselves for a journey up into space. What they find while treading Delios may very well change the course of Malifaux forever… or might just make for a good story once they touch back down to solid ground.

Voyage to the Moon is a challenging One Shot adventure for the Through the Breach roleplaying game. It requires the Core Rules to play.

boardgame.name: Call of Cthulhu: Terror Paths
boardgame.description:
Horrors arise. Your Investigators are the people on the spot. If you can’t stop the Menace now, the city, or even the world, may be doomed. You are the only hope, if you can withstand the terrors and stress of the frights that await you.

Terror Paths is a tabletop cooperative experience for several players. All players take on the role of Investigators, who work together as a team. The game comes with two maps, each with wildly different scenarios. While you can just play a one-off scenario, you can also play the game as a campaign. Keep an eye out for more Terror Paths maps, scenarios, and campaigns.

All the investigators can move and take actions simultaneously, while they puzzle out arcane mysteries, gain insight, and find the tools they need to stave off the Menace. As the adventure begins, you don’t know how to defeat your opposition or even what that opposition consists of!

After the investigators take their turn, the Menace advances. Threat increases, Doom rises, and terrible events occur. Keep in mind that the game has a time limit–if you delay too much, you are ruined. Draw back the veil and embark upon the Terror Path!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Lost Days of Memories and Madness (Game Chef)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The immortal elves of the Eternal Court are masters of the world, enslaving the lesser races so that their most precious possessions – their memories – can be harvested for the pleasure of the decadent elven lords. The greatest fear amongst the immortal elves is madness; the greatest taboo is the mention that the stolen memories of others is the path to insanity.

When your civilisation is at its peak, the only way is down ...
boardgame.rpg: Lost Days of Memories and Madness

boardgame.name: Hearts of Wulin
boardgame.description:
From the Overview:

HEARTS OF WULIN is a roleplaying game emulating long-form Chinese wuxia melodrama. It builds on Apocalypse World, a game created by Meguey and Vincent Baker. If you’ve played other Powered by the Apocalypse (PbtA) games you should find HEARTS OF WULIN easy to pick up. If you haven’t, you may find HEARTS OF WULIN operates a little differently than other roleplaying games.

In HEARTS OF WULIN, the player characters play potent heroes in a fantastic version of ancient China. PCs can do amazing things: fight expertly, balance on roof peaks, run along walls. But for all that skill and competence, the characters are undercut by their own hearts. Unrequited love, conflicting filial duty, loyalty to sworn friends—all these pull the characters in different directions. The PCs try to hold themselves together in order to live up to their heroic ideals. HEARTS OF WULIN doesn’t provide a specific setting. Your table will build that together—establishing the factions and places of your world. HEARTS OF WULIN offers a toolkit for telling these wuxia stories. You can draw on media touchstones like Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon; Hero; Iron Monkey; and The Untamed. There are books, online novels, comics, and more that offer other sources. But HEARTS OF WULIN, first and foremost, aims to emulate a particular kind of wuxia story.

boardgame.name: Overthrow
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Some are just content to clear out an old tomb and sell the treasure for a tidy profit. For those with higher aspirations, Overthrow is about leading a rebellion, and installing yourself as the new leader of THE NATION. But it is not so easy in a backwater island where memories are erased by drug laced currency.

boardgame.name: snow from korea :: sacred bone
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Empress Snow has died, naming no heir, so the Dowager King has summoned all the princes and princesses of Gyerim to the capital for a tournament! They will test their skills of rulership, competing for the throne, for love, and for the right to bear heirs.

And maybe, by doing so, they will make the world a better place.

boardgame.name: Sacred Heroes
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The world of Pentasymm is in moral flux. A spiritual evolution is taking place as ideas come in conflict. Threads of thought are being evaluated, old ones broken, new ones spun, and all are being woven into the fabric of the world.

boardgame.name: Shattered Minds: A Demonic Study of Fragmented Memory
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is some kind of demonic experiment where you will be the test subject. How much of you is defined by your memory, and what happens if these memories change or disappear. How far would you go to keep some remembrance of what has happened before, and would you have any problem with hurting other people if you knew they would completely forget it shortly after.
boardgame.rpg: Shattered Minds: A Demonic Study of Fragmented Memory

boardgame.name: Space Adventure
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Heard about role-playing games but never played one?

Then this is the book for you, it will lead you into a world of Space Opera adventure through easily learned sections of story and rules. You can play any style of space game from Star Wars to Serenity, or stay in the universe of the Palace Combine and memory altering drugs.

boardgame.name: Medieval Farmer
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Medieval Farm Simulator is an opportunity to move to medieval times and become then farmer. You have only primitive tools to:
Create croft for your cattle, for example cows, chickens, sheep and others use wood, nails and hatchet
Prepare the ground using medieval ways of soil fertilization to giving you plants the best conditions of growing. It’s just your decision what kind of plants you will cultivate
Repair the old farm equipment, which is necessary to running the farm, for example attach the wheel to the wheelbarrows using the metal screw
Renovate damaged buildings on you farm to protect your property and harvest against the destruction. For example, patch the holes in the old roof using the new boards and hay.
Become the medieval farmer by taking part in medieval harvest use right equipment to cut the grain and prepare the sheaves.
Discover, how to secure it against atmospheric conditions.


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Technocracy Reloaded
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Future

As the third decade of the 21st century dawns, the Technocratic Union stands on the cutting edge of a future imperiled. As science and technology draw humanity closer than ever before, certain factions within the Masses display gross negligence, undermining the Union’s work and endangering the world for shortsighted gains. Despite global telecommunications, new frontiers in virtually every field of study, and an understanding of the universe only dreamed of by earlier generations, humanity faces threats on all sides.

Can You Save It?

Climate change threatens to destroy life as we know it. Religious fundamentalism breeds terror around the globe. Diseases, once eradicated in the developed world through vaccination, have returned due to antivaxxer movements. Totalitarian, nationalist governments rise as the Masses succumb to fear of the other. The world stands on the brink of destruction, and it is up to the agents and operatives of the Technocratic Union to save it…or be its ultimate destruction.

Technocracy Reloaded peels back the curtain and examines the role of the Technocracy in Mage 20th Anniversary Edition. The various Future Fates presented in Mage 20 are examined and this book introduces a few of its own. This book provides a detailed look at life within the Technocracy, expanded information on the Conventions, a wealth of equipment, Adjustments, and Procedures, a breakdown of the various shadow conspiracies and factions within the Technocratic Union, and tips for running your own Technocracy Chronicle.

boardgame.name: Lycaon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Howling at Olympus

Lycaon (PL12), once King of Arcadia, was wicked and cruel. For his sins, Zeus transformed Lycaon into a monstrous wolf. His progeny became the first werewolves of human legend. He now seeks to destroy all the children of Zeus.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

boardgame.name: ArtMasters: The Game
boardgame.description:
Immerse yourself in ArtMASTERS-The Game: A fun, challenging competition between 2 to 4 Players ages 14+ to create famous paintings by famous artists one tile at a time! You don't have to be an artist, or even need to know a lot about art. Your game board Canvas is your guide. With each tile drawn, every Player can be an accomplished artist as a Masterpiece is revealed! It's all in the Tube.

How ArtMASTERS is Played

The Object of the Game is to be the first to complete a Masterwork painting in tiles on your game board, call Frame It! and score. 2 to 4 can play.

You don't have to be an artist, or need to know a lot about art. Your game board Canvas is your guide.

Draw Game tiles from the Tube.
Decide which of three paintings to re-create on your game board Canvas.
Tile-by-tile create a famous artist's Masterpiece.
Be the first to complete a 3x4 inch painting in 12 tiles and call Frame It! to score.
Only the Player who calls Frame It! for a completed painting scores for that round.

The Game ends when a Player reaches 500 points.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Speed of Forgetting
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Your only salvation from a mind destroying disease is found in serving the corrupt corporations that govern the land. If you knew the disease was really the result of a brainwashing experiment perpetrated by the corporations, would you give up the drug that keeps your memories alive to bring down the corporation that supplies it?

boardgame.name: Temple of the Sacred Harlot
boardgame.description:
A Roleplaying Game for Consenting Adults

From the introduction:

Look there. Listen. Watch and wait.

Soon, seven horsemen will crest the hill, riding as if the doom of the world was on their heels, smelling the sweat on their backs.

See there? Hear them?

boardgame.name: The Novikov Principle
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Visitors from the future tour major events in history. But the past isn't all it used to be...

boardgame.name: The Paths
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Paths is a Role Playing Game set in a land full of Stone Axes, Saber Toothed Tigers, Spirits, as well as the natural materials that comprise the components of the mecha like suits called Guiles. Taking on the role of a defender of your people, The Paths allows for a wide range of gaming, with a simple dice mechanic that allows for swift and brutal combat, as well as allowing for creativity and luck to play a part.

boardgame.name: Thorns and Blossoms
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The World was changed. Great evil roams the Landscape and the earth rebels against itself. You are humanity's last hope, Sacred Guardians wielding immense powers.

boardgame.name: Kingdomino: Platinium Castle
boardgame.description:
A single castle promo figure that you can use to dress up your Kingdomino game.

This item does not have any unique rules, but rather replaces one of the colored castles in the game.

boardgame.name: Traveling to and From the Land of a Thousand Kings: A Brief Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Another World ... Another Life

The Land of a Thousand Kings is a secret world, though it can be found easily enough by anyone who cares to find an entrance to it. It is a different world, a magical world, and only those with a yearning heart and a fiery imagination will bother to find it at all. It is a secret between you and me, held close and held dear, shared like love with friends and lovers. We get together, one and one, two and two, as many friends as we hold dear in our memories, and we undertake there adventures that will change their world just as certainly as they will change our hearts.
boardgame.rpg: Traveling to and From the Land of a Thousand Kings

boardgame.name: Kingdomino: Octopus Castle
boardgame.description:
A single castle promo figure that you can use to dress up your Kingdomino game.

This item does not have any unique rules, but rather replaces one of the colored castles in the game.

boardgame.name: Thread Dysfunction
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Four players, one character, limitless possibilities. Reality offers limitless possibilities for magic, for life, and for conflict. Now, one Problem demands the same person in four different Threads of reality solve it. Four characters will start the same and end up very different.

boardgame.name: AEON: The Emergence of Life
boardgame.description:
It’s round about 4 billion years ago. Earth has just recently cooled off enough to have water on its surface. Impacts of comets and meteorites have almost ceased. The sky is orange and dense with thick clouds, through which a faint Sun barely shines. A vast, greenish, muddy ocean covers almost the entire planet. The little dry land is black volcanic rocks and barren. But deep in the ocean and in a few oases, something is cooking: life is about to emerge.

In AEON, you and your friends represent prebiotic environments where Life might have emerged. Together, you build a network of chemical reactions that transforms simple prebiotic reactants into complex molecules. Eventually, these molecules will allow you to establish the basic mechanisms of life which make the reactions more efficient.
The first player to create all the requirements for the emergence of biological evolution wins the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – New Vegas Rules Expansion
boardgame.description:
Enter the dangerous world of the Mojave wasteland, Fight over its future at the Hoover Dam, and get some R and R on the lush New Vegas Strip – if you can afford the entry fee!

The Mojave wasteland stretches from New California Territory to the contested Hoover Dam, containing all sorts of treasures for the bold and dangers for the unwary. For those who come out on tip there is glory or territory to be gained; the unlucky join the desert sands of feed the geckos.

The risks are high, but the rewards are great, all within sight of the glowing lights of New Vegas!

This essential rules expansion allows you to add the flora, fauna and characters from New Vegas to your games of Wasteland Warfare. The New Vegas Rules Expansion includes cards for playing with new Fallout: Wasteland Warfare sets, as well as rules and scenarios for playing in the Mojave wasteland.

The accompanying 40-page rulebook includes a guide to building and painting your NCR and Legion models, a miniatures gallery, new rules for storyline events, a five mission campaign allowing you to refight the battle for the Hoover Dam (with the faction of your choice) and mini achievements to try to earn in games.

Faction/model type rules included in the set cover the NCR, Caesar’s Legion and the Super Mutant Nightkin as well as key characters and allies for the Survivors.

Includes 81 Poker and 150 Euro mini pop-out cards.

Units profiles and AI cards included in this set cover:

The Courier
The Burned Man

boardgame.name: Time's Knot Garden
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Cast out of time and adrift.

Can you regain your old life?

Or will you meddling cause more harm?

boardgame.name: Beyond Good and Evil 2 (2009)
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




The game was officially cancelled or abandoned and is no longer in development. An unfinished version(s) of it may or may not have been made available to the public at some point.




Rumors about a sequel began to circulate around 2007, starting with a Nintendo Power interview with Ancel who stated he was working on a new project that was very personal to him, and mentioned his hopes to reuse Jade, the player-character from Beyond Good & Evil, in a future project without changing her personality. Ancel said in a May 2008 interview with the French magazine Jeuxvideo.fr that the Beyond Good & Evil sequel had been in pre-production for a year, but was yet to be approved by Ubisoft.

Later that month, as part of their "Ubidays" event, Ubisoft released a trailer that used Beyond Good & Evil music assets and showed characters that appeared to be Jade and Pey'j from the original Beyond Good & Evil. Ubisoft reported that the trailer had all been recorded within the game engine, showcasing high-resolution graphics representative of seventh generation consoles capabilities. A second, leaked trailer appeared for the game on the Internet around May 2009, showing a character that appeared to be Jade running through a crowded street. The trailer was confirmed to be authentic by Ancel, while Ubisoft denied that they had purposely released the footage.

boardgame.name: Together
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Together is a game of the imagination; it is played by talking to each other. In it you will take on the role of a character, your representative in the game who is an imaginary person living in the imaginary world that the game takes place in. The character has no representation in the game; they exist in the minds of those you play with only in as much detail as you can give them by describing their actions and the words they say. This isn’t improvised theatre so there is no need to act out their actions or put on an accent – but if you want to do that, so much the better.

boardgame.name: Yakuza Palace
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

For several months, the yakuza families of Tokyo have been at war. Tonight, the war comes to a climax at a massive pachinko parlor called "The Palace." Each player will take the role of a member of a different yakuza family, trying to make sure that their family comes out ahead in the war.

boardgame.name: Mythic Mischief
boardgame.description:
In Mythic Mischief, you play as a faction of Mythic Manor students competing to get as many of the other students caught by the Tomekeeper as you can without getting caught yourself.
Each Faction has its own unique set of abilities to move around the board, move the other factions into the path of the Tomekeeper, and even alter the course of the Tomekeeper by moving bookshelves.
Players are able to upgrade their Faction’s abilities throughout the game by collecting powerful Tomes from around the library.
The winner is the first Team to score 10 Mischief Points or the Team with the most points when the Tomekeeper finishes returning all of the Tomes after lunch!

—description from the publisher

New preorder original KS headmaster pledge which includes ghost and storage solution and trays for all expansion
Final sale

boardgame.name: Stars Hollow
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Chilton is a venerable New England institution that’s dominated by old money families. The parents and administration know that the students there are smart and capable, but THEY don’t know as much as they think. First, Chilton students are like high school students anywhere else in America - they find ways to get drunk and places to sneak off for sex. Second, the school encourages competition for spots at Ivy League schools, but doesn’t grasp why that atmosphere expresses itself in meanness and petty power struggles. They’re always roping parents into organizing activities and that leads to a surprising number of students’ moms around for a boarding school. And even for an elite school Chilton is surprisingly old-fashioned. The classes are largely the same as they were in the 1950s and educational reforms seem to just pass Chilton by.

boardgame.name: Land of Broken Hearts
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The strong if they are not careful will become weak

The weak if they are not very careful will become weaker

Eventually if they are not careful they will become totally ineffectual

Beware too much interaction, keep your thoughts to yourself, silence is often safer

boardgame.name: RimWorld - Ideology
boardgame.description:
With the Ideology expansion, each person in the game gets a belief system.

Belief systems define social roles for leaders, moral guides, and skill specialists. They invoke rituals from gentle festivals to brutal sacrifices. They guide preferences around food, comfort, love, technology, and violence. They venerate specific animals, desire different apparel and tattoos, and give access to different buildings and strategies.

Everything is customizable. Make your own story of pirate nudist cannibals, blind undergrounder mole people, charitable ranching cowboys, machine-obsessed transhumanists, or rustic peaceful tribes who link with curious tree creatures.

You can build mind-bending temples with colorful drug motifs, terrifying sacrificial altars clad in skulls, winding mazes of underground tunnels full of technology, or beautiful orchards with drifting leaves.

You’ll hold unforgettable rituals - sick dance parties with pounding music, bountiful feasts of human flesh, beautiful skylantern festivals, ceremonial blindings, Christmas festivities around the tree, vicious gladiator duels, and more.

As you grow powerful, you’ll hunt for the venerated relics of your belief system in new multi-part quests. Penetrate ancient complexes full of diverse threats. Infiltrate wary tribal villages and hack downed spacedrones while holding off other treasure-hunters. Find the relic in its ancient temple and bring it back to your reliquary to attract wealthy pilgrims to your colony and help you convert even more people to your beliefs.

And when you’re successful and secure, you can seek transcendence beyond reality in the new, epic archonexus endgame.

Ideology makes your story into your story more than ever before.

[Soured from Steam store page]

boardgame.name: The Dreamer's Genii
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Dreamer is a person who lives in The Real World. The Dreamer could be literally anyone who is Real. In this text, we act if the Dreamer is male, but the Dreamer can just as easily be female. The story we tell is a biography of sorts, but we focus on very specific points in the Dreamer's life: the points where dreams are born, changed, or obliterated. The game begins when the Dreamer is old enough to dream. The game ends when the Dreamer is... well, hold on. Let's take it slow.

boardgame.name: Spy Sabotage
boardgame.description:
In Spy Sabotage, you enter a secret underground auction where the goal is simple: Outbid your opponents in order to collect the three items you need to complete your mission. However, there will be other spies surrounding you, willing to do whatever it takes to obtain the items needed for their own missions. Place your bids strategically and sabotage your opponents when the moment is right!

Spy Sabotage is a fast-paced strategy game for 2-6 players. At the beginning of the game, each player receives a Mission card that shows them the 3 items they need to collect to win the game. Each player also receives the limited funds they will use to collect those items. Each round of the game, players will silently bid on the items available with the goal of collecting their three items, while preventing their opponents from collecting the items they need. Each player also has one Sabotage they can use each game, which destroys an item as well as any bids placed on the item. The first player to collect all three of their items wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Earthborne Rangers
boardgame.description:
Earthborne Rangers is a customizable, co-operative card game set in the wilderness of the far future. You take on the role of a Ranger, a protector of the mountain valley you call home: a vast wilderness transformed by monumental feats of science and technology devised to save the Earth from destruction long ago.

You begin by building a deck that reflects your Ranger's interests, personal history, and personality. Then, as you explore the open world and your story takes shape, you augment your deck with improved equipment, refined skills, and the memories of your journey.

The story of Earthborne Rangers is presented as a branching narrative campaign consisting of a main storyline and a multitude of side stories. In it, you can choose to follow the critical path or to strike off on your own to discover the Valley's many engaging characters, mysterious ruins, and beings both familiar and strange.

Each game session represents one day in the Valley, and you'll pick up in the same location on the map where you rested the night before. Your goal is to either complete one of your available missions or to explore the open world. The session ends when you're either forced to rest (through either fatigue or injury), or you choose to rest for the night.

An individual game session is played in rounds, and those rounds consist of turns. On your turn, you perform one action: either play a card from your hand, or choose an action from a card on the table. Each action allows you to interact thematically and narratively with the world, and each time you take an action, the world comes to life around you. Predators stalk their prey, rain pours from the sky, rocks tumble down the mountain to block your path, and much more.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Earthborne Rangers: Legacy of the Ancestors

boardgame.name: Devenez Chef: Recettes de Grand-mère
boardgame.description:
Cook with family or friends a mystery menu to discover throughout the game. At the end of the game, taste your chef's achievement: a complete menu (starter, main course, dessert)

Difficulty level: 3 out of 3 – Grand chef level
Main ingredients: spinach, veal, apple
Other ingredients: mushrooms, rice, carrots, celery, old-fashioned mustard, crème fraiche, bay leaf and leek

Gameplay

Choose your mystery menu according to your favorite themes or flavors
Build up your brigade of 2 to 6 players
Prepare your ingredients with the supplied shopping list
Gather your material with the supplied material list
Cook step by step and enjoy your chef's menu:


While cooking, spice up your game and try to earn stars by taking up challenges, by answering quizzes or riddles slipped into your game.

Once all the missions have been completed, have a good time while tasting your menu together.

Winning conditions:
The winner is the player or team who scored the most "stars"

Each box contains numbered "Mission" cards, 1 shopping list, 1 equipment list, the rules of the game and its scoreboard.

—description from the publisher (translated)
